Data.event_text: Daniela Soto-Innes, 28, has been named The World's Best Female Chef by The World's 50 Best Restaurants list. Data.event_text: During the "5th March for Peace", Cuernavaca Bishop Ramón Castro Castro declares that 18 of 36 municipal governments in the state of Morelos are controlled by drug dealers. Governor Cuauhtémoc Blanco, who as mayor had led the marches, was notably absent.
The 2019 Nor.Ca. Women's Handball Championship in Mexico City is won by Cuba women's national handball team.

The government of Mexico City announces its Plan de Reduccíon de Emisisiones del Sector Movilidad ("Plan for Reduction of Emissions in Transportation") with the intent of reducing vehicular-caused pollution by 2024. The plan includes severe restrictions on private and commercial transportation and encourages the use of mass transit and non-polluting transportation.

Data.event_text: Mexico's Interior Secretary, Olga Sánchez Cordero, announces that Mexico will send 6,000 members of the National Guard to the border with Guatemala in response to U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to impose tariffs on all Mexican goods unless immigration is lessened. Later the same day, Trump announced that an agreement had been reached, and the tariffs will be suspended.

Data.event_text: Revolution Day (Mexico) (celebrated Monday).

Former Governor of Baja California, Francisco Vega de Lamadrid, is accused of a MXN $1,200,000,000 (US$60 million) fraud and embezzlement involving 90 businesses and 40 "ghost companies." Governor Jaime Bonilla Valdez says former governors José Guadalupe Osuna Millán and Eugenio Elorduy Walther should also be investigated.

links.text: -Marca Claro, Nov 17, 2019-

-"Acusan a Kiko Vega de replicar estafa maestra; lo denuncian de fraude por $1,200 millones" [Kiko Vega is accused of replicating the "Master Scam; he is accused of fraud for $1.2 billion pesos], Excelsior (in Spanish), November 20, 2019"90 empresas, 40 creadas en un solo día, forman parte de la Estafa Maestra panista en BC con la que se desviaron al menos mil 200 millones de pesos" [90 businesses, 40 created in a single day, form part PAN's "Estafa Maestra" in BC so that they could divert $1.2 billion pesos], Revolucion Tres Punto Cero (in Spanish), November 20, 2019-

Data.event_text: An earthquake with a 6.3 MW with an epicenter 116 km northeast of Puerto Madero strikes Chiapas. Minor damages are reported.

Data.event_text: Mexican Navy Day
Thousands march in Mexico City in demand of elimination of violence against women. 200 women demonstrate in Ciudad Nezahualcóyotl, State of México.

Data.event_text: The National Supreme Court of Justice (SCJN) rules that private schools cannot withhold grades or exams of students who have unpaid debts.

links.text: -Se manifiestan en Nezahualcóyotl contra feminicidios en el Edomex Javier Salinas Cesáreo, La Jornada, 25 nov 2019-

Data.event_text: Four police officers and seven armed civilians, members of the Cartel del Norte, are killed in a shootout in Villa Unión, Coahuila. Six other police officers are injured. The death toll reaches 21 on .

Data.event_text: Two judges who freed the ex-husband of Abril Perez, a woman who was murdered in Mexico City on , have been suspended.

Data.event_text: The oversold Knotfest 2019 music festival in the Deportivo Oceanía Mexico City is canceled after violence breaks out after "Evanescense" fails to perform as scheduled. Unconfirmed deaths are reported.

Data.event_text: Foreign Secretary Marcelo Ebrard recalls Mexican Ambassador to Argentina Óscar Ricardo Valero Recio Becerra after Valero Recio is caught trying to steal an MXN $189 (US$10) book from a Buenos Aires bookstore.

links.text: -JOSÉ RAÚL LINARES (December 5, 2019), "Margarita Ríos-Farjat es elegida nueva ministra de la Suprema Corte" [Margarita Ríos-Farjat is elected new justice of the Supreme Court], Proceso (in Spanish)-

Data.event_text: Jorge Zapata, grandson of Emiliano Zapata, sues painter Fabián Cháirez, the Secretariat of Culture, and the Palacio de Bellas Artes over a 2014 painting that depicts the Revolutionary general as wearing a pink hat and high heels. The following day, four groups of peasants force their way into Bellas Artes and try to burn the painting. Members of the LGBQT community defend the painting.

links.text: -Arturo Rodriguez Garcia (December 8, 2019), "Ebrard ordena al embajador en Argentina volver a México y amaga con destituirlo por intentar robar un libro" [Ebard orders the Ambassador to Argentina to return to Mexico and threatens to remove him from his post for stealing a book], Proceso (in Spanish)-

-VERÓNICA BACAZ (December 9, 2019), "Familia de Zapata demandará a artista y al INBAL por pintura gay del 'Caudillo del Sur'" [Zapata's family wo;; sue the painter and the INBAL for a gay painting of the 'Caudillo del Sur'], El Financiero (in Spanish)-

-Yazmin Navarro (December 10, 2019), "VIDEO: Campesinos irrumpen en Bellas Artes para quemar pintura de Emiliano Zapata" [Video: Peasants break into Bellas Artes to burn painting of Emiliano Zapata], SDP Noticias (in Spanish)-

Data.event_text: Genaro García Luna, Secretary of Public Security (2006-2012) under President Felipe Calderon is arrested in Dallas, Texas, accused of accepting cocaine trafficking and receiving bribes of between US$3 million and $5 million from Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán.

Data.event_text: Referendum on the Mayan Train in Chiapas, Tabasco, Campeche, Yucatán, and Quintana Roo. 92.3% (93,142) of the voters who participated voted "yes" and 7.4% (7,517) voted "no", with 268 of 269 voting districts reporting.

Data.event_text: Two are killed in an electrical fire at La Merced Market in Mexico City. This comes just three days after a similar fire destroyed the San Cosme market in Cuauhtémoc borough. In , 60 people were killed at La Merced in a fireworks disaster.

links.text: -"A pesar de la protesta de México, Bolivia aumenta la vigilancia en la embajada en La Paz" [Despite Mexico's protest, Bolivia increases surveillance at the embassy in La Paz]. Aristegui Noticias (in Spanish). December 24, 2019.-
